support_summary: ATXN3 and p97 form a machinery that regulates the homeostasis of RNF8 and stimulates its extraction from chromatin during DNA repair (Co-IP evidence).

functions.function: DNA Damage Response and Genomic Stability
functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 forms a complex with the p97/VCP segregase. This p97-ATXN3 machinery regulates the homeostasis of the E3 ubiquitin ligase RNF8. Under physiological conditions, the complex prevents premature proteasomal degradation of RNF8. Following genotoxic stress (e.g., ionizing radiation), the p97-ATXN3 complex stimulates the extraction of RNF8 from chromatin at sites of DNA double-strand breaks (DSBs).
functions.effect_description: This regulation of RNF8 levels and localization is critical for a balanced DNA damage response. By extracting RNF8 from chromatin, the p97-ATXN3 complex helps to control the choice between DNA repair pathways (e.g., non-homologous end joining) and prevents the hyper-accumulation of RNF8 at damage sites, which can be toxic. This ensures efficient DSB repair and promotes cell survival.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 forms a complex with p97 → The p97-ATXN3 complex binds to RNF8 → Under genotoxic stress, RNF8 is recruited to DNA lesions → The p97-ATXN3 machinery extracts RNF8 from chromatin → This balances DNA repair pathway choice → Promotes efficient double-strand break (DSB) repair and ensures genomic stability → Enhances cell survival following DNA damage
specific_effects: Stimulation of RNF8 extraction from chromatin at DNA damage sites
Regulation of RNF8 protein homeostasis to prevent premature degradation
Balancing of DNA double-strand break repair pathway choice
Promotion of cell survival after genotoxic stress

evidence.paper_title: The p97–Ataxin 3 complex regulates homeostasis of the DNA damage response E3 ubiquitin ligase RNF8
evidence.relevant_quote: Under genotoxic stress, when RNF8 is rapidly recruited to sites of DNA lesions, the p97–ATX3 machinery stimulates the extraction of RNF8 from chromatin to balance DNA repair pathway choice and promote cell survival after ionising radiation (IR).
